originalText.text: Extremely disappointed. Seems like a nice guy, did not get any answers to my questions. Still do not have treatment or a reason for my symptoms and bloodwork.

text.text: Extremely disappointed. Seems like a nice guy, did not get any answers to my questions. Still do not have treatment or a reason for my symptoms and bloodwork.

originalText.text: I am so disappointed in Dr. Karamitsos. He knew my last gynecologist who I had complete faith in, who, unfortunately passed away.  I have had an infection for months that should have been cleared up by now.  I had to ask to give a urine specimen upon my second or third visit. I once waited over twenty minutes to a half an hour in a small examining room and his response was "what can I tell you, I'm busy"!  Several visits later I was given a "song and dance" routine that my psoriasis could impact my infection, that perhaps I had diabetes, kidney, liver issues - none of which are true. I kept being told to come back in a few weeks. I was told I shouldn't have a pap smear because the infection could impact the results. I lost my confidence in him and found a far better gynecologist who requires new patients to give urine specimens upon first visit, took bloods, did the pap smear, and upon examination and a highly sophisticated imaging machine in his exam room, found that I have an ovarian cyst! Not discovered by Dr. Karamitsos!  I do not recommend going to this doctor if you're looking for great care.

I have had an infection for months that should have been cleared up by now.  I had to ask to give a urine specimen upon my second or third visit. Several visits later I was given a "song and dance" routine that my psoriasis could impact my infection, that perhaps I had diabetes, kidney, liver issues - none of which are true. I kept being told to come back in a few weeks. I was told I shouldn't have a pap smear because the infection could impact the results. I lost my confidence in him and found a far better gynecologist who requires new patients to give urine specimens upon first visit, took bloods, did the pap smear, and upon examination and a highly sophisticated imaging machine in his exam room, found that I have an ovarian cyst! Not discovered by Dr. Karamitsos!  I do not recommend going to this doctor if you're looking for great care.

originalText.text:
What can I say about this amazing doctor. For years I suffered with heavy menstrual cycles and understood and guided me. He was very honest about having surgery and I truly appreciate it!
Highly recommend him!

text.text:
What can I say about this amazing doctor. For years I suffered with heavy menstrual cycles and understood and guided me. He was very honest about having surgery and I truly appreciate it!
Highly recommend him!

originalText.text: I absolutely love Dr. Karamitsos and his partner Dr. Plakogiannis from Lenox Hill hospital. They've made the delivery of my baby a very pleasant and joyful experience. I needed their kind of support and professionalism because I moved to NY recently, didn't have anyone else, except from my husband, to support me, so they were a family and friends and doctors at the same time for me. Forever thankful!

Forever thankful!

originalText.text: I have known Dr.Karamitsos for many years. He has always been very caring and confident. I feel extremely fortunate to be able to find his latest medical office to continue to be under his care again. He remembers his patients and truly cares about  them. My sincere gratitude and best wishes are for Dr. Karamitsos and his entire team.
